title: Catena Device Model Schema
description: Intended to assist humans to author Catena device models as JSON files as some IDEs can use schemata such as this one to lint models.

multi_set_enabled.title: Multi Set Message Enabled Flag
multi_set_enabled.description: Enables use of the multi-value message to report multiple parameter changes in one message. Otherwise changes will be reported individually using the value message. Defaults to true.

subscriptions.title: Subscriptions Flag
subscriptions.description: When true, indicates that the device supports subscription-based access to subsets of parameters.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Time, in ms, after which device will timeout

access_scopes.title: Access Scopes
access_scopes.description: The access scopes recognised by this device

items.$comment: discussion needed on min & max items

default_scope.description: Objects in the model will have this access scope unless overridden explicitly, or implicitly by inheritance

language_pack.title: Language Pack
language_pack.description: Language Pack A map of string identifiers, e.g. "greeting" to strings which are all in the same language.

language_packs.title: Language Packs
language_packs.description: Language Packs A map of language identifiers to resource dictionaries or language packs for each language supported. The keys shall be patterned on those defined in https://www.mesaonline.org/language-metadata-table, e.g. "es" for Global Spanish. "es-CO" for Colombian Spanish. "pl" for Jezyk polski

constraint_map.title: map of constraints used for top-level shared constraints
constraint_map.description: Defines the collection of constraints that are able to be shared amongst params or commands within a device.
constraint_map.$comment: patternProperties regex must be same as that defined in oid schema

param_map.title: map of params used for top-level params and commands objects
param_map.description: Defines the collection of parameter and command descriptors for a device, or a subset if the payload of a 'params' message.
param_map.$comment: patternProperties regex must be same as that defined in oid schema

response.title: Response Flag
response.description: When true, indicates that the command associated with the parameter produces a response to the client.

minimal_set.title: Minimal Set Flag
minimal_set.description: When true, indicates that the parameter is part of the minimal set of parameters that should be reported by the device.

param.title: Parameter Descriptor
param.description: Defines the type, value, constraints, UI, access modes and configuration options of a parameter.

template_oid.title: Template Object ID
template_oid.description: JSON pointer to a parameter descriptor that to provide default information for all fields of this parameter.

value.title: Parameter value
value.description: Value of the parameter. Its schema is polymorphic dependent on type.

float32_value.title: FLOAT32
float32_value.description: Defines FLOAT32 as a primitive number type

float32_constraint.title: Float32 Constraint
float32_constraint.description: Range constraint with step size and display min/max

apply_float32.title: FLOAT32 specialism
apply_float32.description: Applies FLOAT32 values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with FLOAT32

int32_value.title: INT32
int32_value.description: Defines INT32 as a primitive number type

int32_constraint.title: INT32 Constraint
int32_constraint.description: Range constraint with step size and display min/max

type.title: INT32 Constraint types
type.description: Constraints for integers and integer arrays

int_choice.title: int choice constraint
int_choice.description: maps strings intended for display in client to integers

alarm.title: Alarm
alarm.description: Occupies a bit position in an alarm table

apply_int32.title: INT32 specialism
apply_int32.description: Applies INT32 values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this type

int32_array_values.title: INT32_ARRAY
int32_array_values.description: Defines INT32 array as a type

apply_int32_array.title: INT32 ARRAY specialism
apply_int32_array.description: Applies INT32 ARRAY values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this type

float32_array_values.title: FLOAT32_ARRAY
float32_array_values.description: Defines FLOAT32 array as a type

apply_float32_array.title: FLOAT32 ARRAY specialism
apply_float32_array.description: Applies FLOAT32 ARRAY values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this type

string_value.title: STRING
string_value.description: Defines STRING as a primitive string type

apply_string.title: STRING specialism
apply_string.description: Applies STRING values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this type

string_array_values.title: STRING_ARRAY
string_array_values.description: Defines STRING array as a type

apply_string_array.title: STRING ARRAY specialism
apply_string_array.description: Applies STRING ARRAY values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this type

struct_array_values.title: STRUCT_ARRAY
struct_array_values.description: Defines STRUCT array as a type

apply_struct_array.title: STRUCT ARRAY specialism
apply_struct_array.description: Applies STRUCT ARRAY values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this type

struct_value.title: STRUCT
struct_value.$comment: pattern properties must be same regex as for oid

struct_fields.title: struct definition
struct_fields.description: holds struct data fields or params

apply_struct.title: STRUCT specialism
apply_struct.description: Applies STRUCT values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this specialism

import.title: Import directive
import.description: Provides the ability to build device models from multiple files. If a URL is provided, the import will be attempted from there. When absent, the import will be a local file named <schema>.<oid>.json.

slot.title: Slot ID
slot.description: Uniquely identifies the device within the scope of its Catena connection

detail_level.title: Level of Detail
detail_level.description: The level of detail in device messages and parameter updates. 'full' indicates that all parameters are reported, 'minimal' that only the minimal set is, 'subscription' reports the minimal set plus identified subscribed parameters, 'commands' reports only descriptors for commands and not for parameters, and 'none' indicates that no parameters or commands should be automatically reported by the device (parameter descriptors, command descriptors, and values can still be pulled).

basic_param_info.title: Basic Param Info
basic_param_info.$comment: not having oid as required is correct because this schema is used in 2 places - param which would be duplicative, and as a message payload where it's needed

oid.title: Object ID
oid.description: An object ID unique within the device model scope

polyglot_text.title: Polyglot Text
polyglot_text.description: Text that a client can display in one of multiple languages

language_metadata_table.title: Language Metadata Table
language_metadata_table.$comment: The language codes must be valid Language Metadata Table language codes. The validation could be done as one super-long regex, but, for readabilty, we've split them into language groups.

language_pack_reference.title: Language Pack Reference
language_pack_reference.description: A key to look up text in a language pack

readonly.title: Parameter access mode
readonly.description: If set true, parameter is read only

widget.title: Widget
widget.description: Suggests the widget used to display the parameter in the UI

precision.title: Precision
precision.description: Number of decimal places to display

max_length.title: Maximum Length
max_length.description: Maximum number of characters in a string

total_length.title: Total Length
total_length.description: Total number of characters in a string array

access_scope.title: Access Scope
access_scope.description: The access scope for this parameter

client_hints.title: Client Hints
client_hints.description: Hints to the client about how to display the parameter

oid_aliases.title: Object ID Aliases
oid_aliases.description: Additional Object IDs that this parameter has had. This allows a client to locate a parameter that may previously have been known by another Object ID

constraint.title: Constraint to apply to parameter value
constraint.description: Constraints on how the value of the parameter can change. Its schema is polymorphic dependent on type

growth_type.title: Growth type to apply to INT32 and FLOAT32 range constraints
growth_type.description: Growth type for range constraints defines how the 'step' field is interpreted.

apply_struct_variant.title: STRUCT_VARIANT specialism
apply_struct_variant.description: Applies STRUCT_VARIANT values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this specialism

variant_array_values.title: VARIANT_ARRAY
variant_array_values.description: Defines how VARIANT ARRAY values are represented

apply_struct_variant_array.title: STRUCT VARIANT ARRAY specialism
apply_struct_variant_array.description: Applies STRUCT VARIANT ARRAY values & constraints, disables properties that don't work with this type

stateless.title: Stateless Flag
stateless.description: When true, indicates that the parameter is stateless and does not require to be persisted. This is useful for values that are transient in nature: current time, audio meters, ...
